cluster_relations.rel_desc: Repeated thermal cycling particularly promotes or aggravates cracking due to thermal fatigue.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject condition or process causes, initiates, or worsens the occurrence or severity of the damage or phenomenon represented by the object.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: SeverityContext: repeated cycling increases likelihood/severity of cracking

remarks: Direction chosen from loading condition (repeated thermal cycling) to damage (cracking).
Direction chosen from loading condition (repeated thermal cycling) to damage (cracking).

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Repeated thermal cycling inherently involves variations in temperature over time.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject process or condition inherently includes the object phenomenon or sub-process as part of its behavior or composition.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: ConceptualLink: thermal cycling consists of successive temperature variations

remarks: Relation added with lower confidence; primarily to connect the cycling process to the underlying temperature variations.
Relation added with lower confidence; primarily to connect the cycling process to the underlying temperature variations.
